summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from April 2023 regarding the identification and verification of a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein. An FBI Victim Specialist in New York is consulted to check if a claimant is already listed in their records, highlighting the process of victim identification and coordination.

events.title: Inquiry about Epstein victim claim
events.description: An external inquiry is made to an FBI Victim Specialist regarding a claim from a potential Epstein victim who submitted it independently, seeking verification if she is already listed.

events.title: Confirmation of identified victim
events.description: Follow-up email confirms that the individual in question is an identified victim who had spoken with the FBI and attended a victim briefing.

keyFacts: The FBI maintains a list of identified victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
There are individuals who claim to be victims but have never spoken to law enforcement or been formally identified.
An FBI Victim Specialist in New York can look up names to verify victim status.
The correspondence shows ongoing efforts in 2023 to manage and verify victim claims related to the Epstein case.
Some victims may submit claims independently without going through official channels first.
